author: Gino D'Acampo
method: Preheat the oven to 220C/425F/Gas 7. Beat the eggs in a large bowl. Add the flour and baking powder and whisk in enough milk to make a thick batter, the consistency of double cream. Add the thyme leaves and stir again. Heat a the oil in a small, ovenproof, non-stick frying pan. Pour the batter in and place the cocktail sausages on top. Transfer to the oven and cook for 10-12 minutes, until the batter is golden and the sausages are cooked.  Remove from the oven and serve.
ingredients: 2 free-range eggs,  110g/4oz self-raising flour,  pinch baking powder,  splash milk,  salt and freshly ground black pepper,  2 tsp fresh thyme leaves,  1 tbsp vegetable oil,  100g cooked cocktail sausages
